chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.
items.plainText: Take heed that ye do not your alms before men, to be seen of them: otherwise ye have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.

items.text: Therefore when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
items.plainText: Therefore when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may have glory of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

items.text: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:
items.plainText: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth:

items.text: That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.
items.plainText: That thine alms may be in secret: and thy Father which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.

items.text: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
items.plainText: And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites are: for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen of men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

items.text: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.
items.plainText: But thou, when thou prayest, enter into thy closet, and when thou hast shut thy door, pray to thy Father which is in secret; and thy Father which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

items.text: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.
items.plainText: But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

items.text: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.
items.plainText: Be not ye therefore like unto them: for your Father knoweth what things ye have need of, before ye ask him.

items.text: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.
items.plainText: After this manner therefore pray ye: Our Father which art in heaven, Hallowed be thy name.

items.text: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.
items.plainText: Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.

items.text: Give us this day our daily bread.
items.plainText: Give us this day our daily bread.

items.text: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.
items.plainText: And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtors.

items.text: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.
items.plainText: And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil: For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.

items.text: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:
items.plainText: For if ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you:

items.text: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
items.plainText: But if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

items.text: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.
items.plainText: Moreover when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad countenance: for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear unto men to fast. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward.

items.text: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;
items.plainText: But thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy face;

items.text: That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.
items.plainText: That thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thy Father which is in secret: and thy Father, which seeth in secret, shall reward thee openly.

items.text: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:
items.plainText: Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon earth, where moth and rust doth corrupt, and where thieves break through and steal:

items.text: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:
items.plainText: But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:

items.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.
items.plainText: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

items.text: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.
items.plainText: The light of the body is the eye: if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body shall be full of light.

items.text: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!
items.plainText: But if thine eye be evil, thy whole body shall be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that darkness!

items.text: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.
items.plainText: No man can serve two masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to the one, and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon.

items.text: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?
items.plainText: Therefore I say unto you, Take no thought for your life, what ye shall eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye shall put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the body than raiment?

items.text: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?
items.plainText: Behold the fowls of the air: for they sow not, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenly Father feedeth them. Are ye not much better than they?

items.text: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?
items.plainText: Which of you by taking thought can add one cubit unto his stature?

items.text: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:
items.plainText: And why take ye thought for raiment? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow; they toil not, neither do they spin:

items.text: And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
items.plainText: And yet I say unto you, That even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

items.text: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?
items.plainText: Wherefore, if God so clothe the grass of the field, which to day is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe you, O ye of little faith?

items.text: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?
items.plainText: Therefore take no thought, saying, What shall we eat? or, What shall we drink? or, Wherewithal shall we be clothed?

items.text: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.
items.plainText: (For after all these things do the Gentiles seek:) for your heavenly Father knoweth that ye have need of all these things.

items.text: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
items.plainText: But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.

items.text: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
items.plainText: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
